wikipedia_page.main:
Guto Harri (Welsh pronunciation: [ˈɡɪtɔ.hariː]; born 8 July 1966) is a Welsh broadcaster, writer and strategic communications consultant. 
Harri spent 18 years as a journalist at the BBC. From 2008 to 2012 he was director of external affairs for the Mayor of London, Boris Johnson. He has since worked in a number of roles, first at News International from 2012 to 2015, and from 2016 to 2017 at Liberty Global. In 2018 Harri joined Hanover Communications as a vice president. He left in March 2020 to join Hawthorn Advisors. He remains a director of Hydro Industries.
